title: Super Tough Cards Day After Christmas 24 Hour Sale
author: Archive

posts.post_title: Super Tough Cards Day After Christmas 24 Hour Sale
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Brian C.
These cards will be available to board members at these prices until December 27, 2007 at 11 a.m. West Coast time. Please add $5 per order for shipping. Insurance is offered at the buyer's request in an amount to be determined by the size of the purchase. All sales final on graded cards. Priority of purchase is determined by emails directly to me, not posts on the Board.

1911 E100 Bishop Charles Moore, Los Angeles, Blue Background, SGC 30: SOLD

Obaks
Phil Cooney (Jewish), 1911 Obak, SGC 60 (SGC's highest graded example; 1/1 - see scan below): $1,500
Anson Mott, 1909 Obak, SGC 50 (none graded higher by SGC - see scan below): $750
Terry McKune, 1909 Obak, SGC 40 (just 1 graded higher by SGC): $550
Jud Smith, 1909 Obak, SGC 10 (just 3 graded higher by SGC): $275

T207
John Adams, SGC 50 (highest SGC-graded Adams; 1/1, a VERY tough card -- see scan below), Anonymous back: $1,500
Vean Gregg, SGC 40 (highest SGC-graded Gregg; 1/1), Anonymous back: $1,200
Buddy Ryan, SGC 50 (just 2 graded higher by SGC), Broadleaf back: $500.
Walter Kuhn, SGC authentic (super tough; low pop.), Broadleaf back: $225.
Larry McLean, SGC 60 (just 4 graded higher by SGC), Recruit back: $200.00.
Mike Mitchell (shows Willie Mitchell), SGC 40 (only 1 graded higher by SGC), Recruit back: SOLD
Ivan Olson, SGC 50, Recruit back: $125.
Jack Graney, SGC 40, Recruit back: $75.

Miscellaneous baseball
Dick Breen, Imperial Tobacco (1912), SGC 40 (only 1 graded higher by SGC): $175.
T210 (1910) Rose, SGC 10 (super tough; this is the only one graded by SGC): $175.
Danny Shay, E91A (1908), SGC 40 (none graded higher by SGC), $175.
Jack Graney, M101-4(1916), SGC 30 (just one graded higher by SGC): $175.
Walter Ruether, Yeunglings (1928), SGC 40 (this is the only one graded by SGC): $175.

Boxing
T229 Pet Cigarettes Abe Atell (SGC 30) and Monte Attell (SGC 10). Cross collectible for Jewish collectors, Black Sox collectors, boxing collectors, and T229 collectors: $1,750.

Hi Scott, thanks for your question. Yes, the M101-4 is a blank back.
